de.liwacom.simone

Class SimoneApi

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.liwacom.simone.SimoneApi
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SimoneConst

    public class SimoneApi
extends java.lang.Object
implements SimoneConst

    The Java class SimoneApi is the Java Language binding for the SIMONE API Library written in the 'C'-Language.

    This class is nearly a 1:1 mapping of function from the original 'C'-library into Java functions in this class. But due to the different behavior of the languages there are some minor differences in implementation.

    In the 'C'-Language it is possible to supply parameters for primitive datatypes such as 'int' or 'float' by reference. This is heavily used in the original SIMONE API 'C'-Library to return multiple values in the single function call.
    Java does not allow returning values for parameters of primitive data types. To solve this problem at any place a parameter is an 'OUT' parameter, which means the parameter returns a value, the Java functions expects an instance of a wrapper class for the primitive data type to be supplied instead.

    For example the routine simone_varid is defined for the 'C'-Language as :

    INT32 simone_varid(char *name, INT32 *obj_id, INT32 *ext_id);

    expecting a string and returning 2 integer values.
    These 2 integer parameters has to be replaced in the Java version by the wrapper class 'SimInt'. The Java routine is the declared as:

    public int simone_varid (String name, SimInt obj_id, SimInt ext_id);

    which then allows to return 2 integer values for 'obj_id' and 'ext_id'.
    This method is used at any places a routine from the 'C'-Language SIMONE API library returns values at parameter positions.
    The following wrapper classes should be used instead of the primitive data types in 'C'

    'C'-Language return type Java Wrapper Class
    INT32*SimInt
    INT64*SimLong
    float*SimFloat
    double*SimDouble
    time_t*SimTimeT
    char*SimString

    Another difference in the functions signatures between the original 'C'- and the Java routines in this class is that the 'C'-routines expects the max. length for all string output parameters to be supplied as dedicated parameters.
    For the Java routines this max. string length is not applicable and therefore all parameters for the max. supplied string length is omitted from the parameter lists for the Java routines. The Java routines always returns Strings as instances of the class SimString. The internal implementation makes sure that buffers of sufficient length are internally supplied to the original 'C'-SIMONE API library.

    Furthermore at any places where the original SIMONE API documentation states that either a NULL pointer or an empty string can be supplied if the parameter value is either to be treated as 'DO NOT USE' or 'DO NOT RETURN A VALUE' it is safe to supply a 'null' reference in Java (or also an empty string).



    @since 2.67 of the SIMONE API

    SIMONE API Extension to create/modify network models

    A new SIMONE API Extension allows to manage the network model and its objects programmatically by routines. This module implements routines to create/load/store/edit SIMONE network models by using the SIMONE API. The user can either load the active or edited topology of the currently selected network. The store operation will always store the supplied network model as edited version of the topology eventually overwriting any already existing version. The main object provided is the NetworkModel. The NetworkModel provides routines to create other sub-object like:

    • Subsystems
    • Nodes
    • Elements
    • Labels
    • Text Label Linces
    • Label images
    • Layer
    • Quality Tracking
    • Gas Default Values
    • Gas Qualities
    • Gas Qualities at Nodes
    • Reference Conditions

    The routine simone_nw_start_edit() has to be called before any other routine dealing with network information/modification. All routines creating objects returns a 32-Bit integer Handle for referencing these objects. To release/destroy an object created the user of the library has to call the routine simone_nw_handle_release() unless otherwise noted to avoid any kind of resource leak.


    WARNING

    Since Version 2.67 of the SIMONE-API it is required to also add SimEdit.jar to the list of required libraries for you Java SIMONE-API application. The file SimEdit.jar can be found in the jbin sub folder of the SIMONE installation directory.


    WARNING

    The SIMONE API routines requires extended stack spaces. Due to that it is required to increase the stack space used by the Java VM to at least 1MB. Please add the switch "-ss1024k" for any programs using the SIMONE API Java Language Binding

    Version:
    2.8.0
    Author:
    Liwacom Informationstechnik GmbH

      int simone_online_init(java.lang.String task, java.lang.String inic, SimString status_msg, int flags)
      Initialization of a cyclic task The cyclic function must not be active, but the cyclic control must be runnning An initial state may be specified: INIT for a 'cold start', a mapped state, or the terminal state of a scenario indicated by the name of the scenario If none is specified, the last recently calculated state of the respective cyclic simulation is used In case of PRSIM and LEAK, the initialisation by default also initializes the cyclic result storage, the flag 'SIMONE_FLAG_REINIT' may be specified to keep the result history Note: This function only works if SIMONE API: Extensions is licensed.
      int simone_online_replace_network(java.lang.String new_network, SimString status_msg, int flags)
      Replace the current online network with a new_network All cyclic tasks must be stopped before calling this function Note: This function only works if SIMONE API: Extensions is licensed.

        public static void simone_api_set_simone_path(java.lang.String simone_install_path)
        allows to set the path for a valid SIMONE installation. The path is used to find any required shared libraries/DLL required to initialise the SIMONE Java API wrapper. This method needs to be called BEFORE calling getInstance() or getRemoteApiInstance()
        Parameters:
        simone_install_path - path to a valid SIMONE installation

      • getInstance

        public static SimoneApi getInstance()
        returns a reference to the one and only SimoneApi object. creates new object if it does not already exists or returns only the reference to the already created object Call simone_api_set_simone_path() before this method to make sure all required SIMONE resources can be found.
        Returns:
        reference to the one and only SimoneApi object. throws UnsatifiedLinkError if the SIMONE API dll cant be loaded

      • getRemoteApiInstance

        public static SimoneApi getRemoteApiInstance()
        returns a reference to a remote SIMONE API instance
        The Remote SIMONE API does not execute SIMONE API commands directly by itself but forwards the requests to a SIMONE API Server running anywhere in the network. To select the SIMONE API Server to connect to call simone_set_remote_connection (String serverhost, int port) before using simone_init() or simone_init_ex().
        This routine creates a new object for any thread which does not already had called the function or returns only the reference to the already created object All functions called through an instance created by getRemoteApiInstance() are thread-safe !
        Call simone_api_set_simone_path() before this method to make sure all required SIMONE resources can be found.
        Returns:
        reference to a remote SIMONE API instance throws UnsatifiedLinkError if the Remote SIMONE API dll cant be loaded
        Since:
        2.36 of the SIMONE API

      • releaseRemoteApiInstance

        public void releaseRemoteApiInstance()
        releases the remote API instance created by previous call to getRemoteApiInstance(). This routine should be called if the remote API Instance is no longer required to release any internally allocated memory resources.
        Since:
        2.36 of the SIMONE API

      • simone_set_remote_connection

        public int simone_set_remote_connection(java.lang.String serverhost,
                                        int port)
        allows to specify the hostname and port used to connect to the SIMONE API Server if the REMOTE API Library is used. Wihtout specifying the connection information explicitely the remote API at first looks ate the environment variables 'SIMONE_API_SERVER_HOST' and 'SIMONE_API_SERVER_PORT' to get the information. If these variables are not defined 'localhost' and '6615' is used as default.
        Parameters:
        serverhost - hostname or IP-address of host to connect to (the SIMONE API Server)
        port - port number to connect to
        Returns:
        • simone_status_not_implemented - if local API is used
        • simone_status_badpar - if serverhost is null or empty or port <= 0
        • simone_status_ok - success

      • simone_init_setopt

        public int simone_init_setopt(int initopt,
                              java.lang.String optval)
        Sets options to control the initialisation process of the SIMONE API.
        These options must be set before the functions simone_init() or simone_init_ex() are called.
        Using this routine always has the consequence that a temporary config-file is used which is automatically deleted upon termination.
        Parameters:
        initopt - SIMONE_INITOPT_REQUEST_LICENSE to request a specific license
        optval - value for above initopt for example "foreground", "background", "viewer", a string containing an integer number or a logical name.
        Returns:
        • simone_status_badseq - wrong calling sequence. Function has to be called before simone_init() / simone_init_ex().
        • simone_status_badpar - unknown option 'initopt' or invalid value 'optval'
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

        initialises the SIMONE API. Must be called before all other routines.

        Returns:

        • simone_status_insuff license - insufficient license level
        • simone_status_badseq - API is already initialised
        • simone_status_nofile - supplied configuration file not found/accessible
        • simone_status_ok - if initialisation was successfull

      • simone_init_ex

        public int simone_init_ex(java.lang.String init_file,
                          int flags)
        This routine extends the functionallity of simone_init(). if 'flags' is set to SIMONE_FLAG_TMP_CONFIG a new temporary configuration file is created from the configuration supplied by 'init_flag'.
        the temoprary configuration is deleted if the program terminates.
        Parameters:
        init_file - specification of SIMONE configuration file without extension. if empty string or null reference is supplied the configruation is determined from the environment
        flags - if SIMONE_NO_FLAG is supplied the config-file to use is determined from the environment
        if SIMONE_FLAG_TMP_CONFIG is supplied a temporary copy of 'ini_file' is created and used. if SIMONE_FLAG_PRC_CLEANUP_AT_END is supplied stop all processes started by SIMONE_API functions before when simone_end() is called.
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicense - if no license was available
        • simone_status_insuff license - insufficient license level
        • simone_status_badseq - API is already initialised
        • simone_status_nofile - supplied configuration file not found/accessible
        • simone_status_ok - if initialisation was successfull

      • simone_change_network_dir

        public int simone_change_network_dir(java.lang.String network_path,
                                     int flags)
        Changes the base directory for SIMONE network models. If the flag SIMONE_FLAG_MAKE_NETWORK_DIR is not set, this function returns the error status simone_status_nofile if the path does not exist or if the path is not a valid SIMONE network path. If the flag is set the path will be created if not existing and the path will be changed to a valid SIMONE network path and the path will be set as actual network path
        Parameters:
        network_path - complete path used to locate/create network models
        flags - SIMONE_FLAG_MAKE_NETWORK_DIR
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicense - no license available
        • simone_status_badseq - wrong calling sequence, SIMONE API not initialised
        • simone_status_badpar - supplied 'network_path' is not a valid directory
        • simone_status_nofile - supplied 'network_path' does not exist or network_path is not a SIMONE network path
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_select

        public int simone_select(java.lang.String network)
        selects (opens) a new network model (closing the previous network if required) the SIMONE API make the selected network the new 'current directory'.
        A read-lock is set to the network which means that other users can read concurrently but writing to the network is prohibited.
        Parameters:
        network - name of the network to be selected. 'network' should be the name of a directory in the current simone base network model directory simone_change_network_dir()
        Returns:
        • simone_staatus_no_license - no license available
        • simone_status_badpar - 'network' is not a valid network model dir (e.q. name too long)
        • simone_status_nofile - network does not exists
        • simone_status_locked - network is currently locked by another application currently modifying (writing to) the 'network'
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_open

        public int simone_open(java.lang.String scenario,
                       int mode_flag)
        Opens or creates a new scenario depeding on the value of 'mode_flag'.
        Only one scenario can be opened at a time. The scenario is opened exclusively which means that no other instance may access it at the same time.
        The scenario is closed (and the exclusive lock in removed) by calling simone_close()
        Parameters:
        scenario - name of the scenario to be opened or newly created
        mode_flag - one of the flags:
        • SIMONE_MODE_CREATE - create a new scenario for writing
        • SIMONE_MODE_WRITE - open an existing scenario for writing
        • SIMONE_MODE_READ - open an existing scenario for read
        • SIMONE_MODE_RW - open existing scenario for read/write
        together with the following additional modifier flags:
        • SIMONE_FLAG_VISIBLE - the (created) scenario should be visible in the SIMONE User Interface
        • SIMONE_FLAG_NO_OPT - disable (internal) optimisations during write to the scenario
        • SIMONE_FLAG_FORCE_OVERWRITE - enforce writing mode value or setpoint value
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicense - no license available
        • simone_status_badseq - wrong calling sequence. API not initialised or no network opened
        • simone_status_badpar - 'scenario' name invalid (e.q. name too long)
        • simone_status_nofile - scenario can not be opened or created
        • simone_status_locked - scenario is already opened by another instance
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_close

        public int simone_close()
        The currently opened scenario simone_open() is closed and the lock held for the scenario is released.
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicense - no license available
        • simone_status_nofile - no scenario currently opened
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

        public int simone_remove(java.lang.String scenario,
                         int flag)
        The supplied scenario or only the scenario simulation results are deleted dependend on the value of 'flag'
        Parameters:
        scenario - The scenario name to delete
        flag - if SIMONE_FLAG_REMOVE_ALL then the scenario is completely deleted.
        if SIMONE_FLAG_REMOVE_RESULTS only the simualtion results are deleted
        if SIMONE_FLAG_REMOVE_CORE_RESULTS then all results are removed (like SIMONE_FLAG_REMOVE_RESULTS) with exception of possibly existing terminal state

        • simone_status_locked - scenario is still in used by another instance
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success
        Since:

                           int flags)

        • SIMONE_FLAG_NODE - return object-id with type node
        • SIMONE_FLAG_ELEMENT - return object-id with type element
        • SIMONE_FLAG_NO_LOGS - do not produce error logs for invalid varnam
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicense - no license available
        • simone_status_badpar - invalid or unknown varnam or found object type does not match with flags
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_get_first_object

        public int simone_get_first_object(int req_object_type,
                                   java.lang.String req_subsys_name,
                                   SimInt objid,
                                   SimString objname,
                                   SimInt object_type,
                                   SimString subsys_name)
        This function starts the iteration process of all objects defined in the current network.
        Parameters:
        req_object_type - type of objects requested (SIMONE_OBJTYPE_NS, ..)
        req_subsys_name - name of subsystem for which objects are requested supply 'null' for all objects in the whole network
        objid - returns object-id of first object
        objname - returns name of first object
        object_type - returns object type of first object
        subsys_name - returns subsystem name the object belongs to. supply 'null' if you are not interested in this information
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicense - no license available
        • simone_status_badseq - no current network
        • simone_status_badpar - unknown subsystem for req_subsys_name
        • simone_status_error - internal error
        • simone_status_not_found - no matching object found
        • simone_status_ok - ok. the first matching object is returned

        public int simone_read_str(int objid,
                           int extid,
                           int unit,
                           SimString value,
                           int width,
                           int precision)
        allows to read values which can not be represented as floats and therefore can not be read using simone_read() or simone_read_array(). This routine reads all types of variables/parameters and translated their values if neccessary into a string. Float values are formatted right aligned according to 'width' and 'precision'
        Parameters:
        objid - ID identifying the object to read for
        extid - ID identifying the extension to read for
        unit - the unit descriptor for the variable/parameter
        value - the returned string value
        width - number of charactes in resulting string for float values
        precision - number of decimals if float value needs to be translated into a string
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicense - no license available
        • simone_status_nofile - no current scenario
        • simone_status_badseq - no current network or scenario not opened in READ mode
        • simone_status_badpar - invalid unit descriptor
        • simone_status_nofloat - value of var/par cant be represented as float value
        • simone_status_noval - no value available for current retrieval time and requested var/par
        • simone_status_invid - invalid object-/extension-ID
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_get_entry_set_filter

        public int simone_get_entry_set_filter(int filter_flags,
                                       int filter_value)
        With this function filters can be set for the following calls of the simone_get_entry() function(s) to search for special entries in the scenario. If the filter flags for OBJ_ID, EXT_ID, COND_ID, FUNC_ID or SRC_ID are set, a call of the simone_get_entry() function reads only entries, which match with the exact filter values.
        • If the filter flags for COND_FLAGS, OBJ_TYPE, PARAM_TYPE are set,
        • a call of the simone_get_entry() function reads only entries,
        • which match with one of the flags in the scenario entry.
        • e. g.: simone_get_entry_set_filter(SIMONE_FLAG_FILTER_OBJ_ID, obj_id)
        • and simone_get_entry_set_filter(SIMONE_FLAG_FILTER_PARAM_TYPE,
        • SIMONE_PARAM_TYPE_SUPPLY_OFFTAKE | SIMONE_PARAM_TYPE_QUALITY)
        • simone_get_entry() read all entries which obj_id matches and
        the parameter (ext_id) is a supply or an offtake or a quality Call simone_get_entry_reset_filter(), if all entries from a scenario should be retrieved.
        Parameters:
        filter_flags - - variable in entries of scenario which value must match
        • SIMONE_FLAG_FILTER_OBJ_ID
        • SIMONE_FLAG_FILTER_EXT_ID
        • SIMONE_FLAG_FILTER_COND_FLAGS
        • SIMONE_FLAG_FILTER_COND_ID
        • SIMONE_FLAG_FILTER_FUNC_ID
        • SIMONE_FLAG_FILTER_SRC_ID
        • SIMONE_FLAG_FILTER_OBJ_TYPE
        • SIMONE_FLAG_FILTER_PARAM_TYPE
        filter_value - - value of variable in entries of scenario which must match
        • The following combination of filter flags and filter value are possible:
        • filter flags filter value
        • SIMONE_FLAG_FILTER_OBJ_ID valid obj_id
        • SIMONE_FLAG_FILTER_EXT_ID valid ext_id
        • SIMONE_FLAG_FILTER_COND_FLAGS SIMONE_FLAG_IF
        • SIMONE_FLAG_IF1
        • SIMONE_FLAG_IFN
        • SIMONE_FLAG_IF1N
        • SIMONE_FLAG_IF_ALL
        • SIMONE_FLAG_FILTER_COND_ID valid cond_id
        • SIMONE_FLAG_FILTER_FUNC_ID valid func_id
        • valid profile id
        • SIMONE_FLAG_FILTER_SRC_ID valid src_id
        • SIMONE_FLAG_FILTER_OBJ_TYPE SIMONE_OBJTYPE_CS
        • SIMONE_OBJTYPE_CV
        • SIMONE_OBJTYPE_PIPE
        • SIMONE_OBJTYPE_RECP
        • SIMONE_OBJTYPE_VA
        • SIMONE_OBJTYPE_SE
        • SIMONE_OBJTYPE_RE
        • SIMONE_OBJTYPE_NS
        • SIMONE_OBJTYPE_NO
        • SIMONE_OBJTYPE_MACRO
        • SIMONE_OBJTYPE_UNIT
        • SIMONE_OBJTYPE_SYS
        • SIMONE_OBJTYPE_MS
        • SIMONE_OBJTYPE_NRV
        • SIMONE_FLAG_FILTER_PARAM_TYPE SIMONE_PARAM_TYPE_SETPOINTS
        • SIMONE_PARAM_TYPE_SUPPLY_OFFTAKE
        • SIMONE_PARAM_TYPE_QUALITY
        • SIMONE_PARAM_TYPE_MEASUREMENTS
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicense - no license available
        • simone_status_badpar - parameter invalid
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_get_entry_reset_filter

        public int simone_get_entry_reset_filter()
        With this function all filters are removed, which are set by previous calls of simone_get_entry_set_filter().
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicense - no license available
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_get_entry

        public int simone_get_entry(SimTimeT rtime,
                            SimInt objid,
                            SimInt extid,
                            SimInt cond_flags,
                            SimInt cond_id,
                            SimFloat value,
                            SimString svalue,
                            SimInt unit,
                            SimInt func_id,
                            SimInt value_flags,
                            SimInt src_id,
                            SimString comment)
        reads entries from the current scenario rather than simulation results. The starting rtime from which entries should be read can be set using simone_set_rtime()
        Parameters:
        rtime - the time stamp for the scenario entry. if 0 the the entry is valid from the start of the scenario
        objid - ID identifying the object
        extid - ID indentifying the extension
        cond_flags - condition type (SIMONE_FLAG_IF, SIMONE_FLAG_IF1, ...)
        cond_id - ID of condition or 0 if entry is unconditioned
        value - float value of entry. Set to NaN if entry does not have a float value
        svalue - value as formatted character string if available and not float value otherwise an empty string is returned
        unit - unit descriptor
        func_id - ID of function or profile combined with value or 0 if not applicable
        value_flags - SIMONE_NO_FLAG or SIMONE_FLAG_INVALID if value is marked as invalid
        src_id - id of source name associated to entry or 0 if no source name associated
        comment - comment string for entry. nte returned if 'null' is supplied
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicense - no license available
        • simone_status_nofile - no current scenario
        • simone_status_badseq - no current network or scenario not opened in READ mode
        • simone_status_badpar - any parameter invalid
        • simone_status_nofloat - value of var/par cant be represented as float value
        • simone_status_noval - no float value returned
        • simone_status_invid - invalid object-/extension-ID
        • simone_status_locked - scenario is alreday in used by another instance
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

        public int simone_write_configuration(int rtime,
                                      int objid,
                                      int extid,
                                      java.lang.String cs_configuration)
        write a scenario entry for setting the configuration of a compressor station The configuration has to be set as text string as it appear in the SIMONE UI.
        Parameters:
        rtime - time_t value for entry to write
        objid - ID identifying the object
        extid - ID identifying the exntension
        cs_configuration - configuration string like "FREE", "GENERIC", "12", .
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicense - no license available
        • simone_status_nofile - no current scenario
        • simone_status_badseq - no current network or scenario not opened in WRITE mode
        • simone_status_badpar - invalid object-/extension-ID
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_write_ex

        public int simone_write_ex(int rtime,
                           int objid,
                           int extid,
                           int cond_flags,
                           int cond_id,
                           float value,
                           java.lang.String value_str,
                           int unit,
                           int func_id,
                           int value_flags,
                           int src_id,
                           java.lang.String comment)
        writes an entry into the current scenario. Extends functionality of simone_write() by providing to supply all available properties of a scenario entry like conditions, functions, source names and comment.
        Parameters:
        rtime - time_t value of the created entry. 0 for start of scenario
        objid - ID identifying the object
        extid - ID identifying th extension
        cond_flags - condition type (SIMONE_NO_FLAG, SIMONE_FLAG_IF, SIMONE_FLAG_IF1,..)
        cond_id - ID of condition function. 0 for no condition
        value - float value to set. supply 0.0 if no float value is neccessare if value_str is supplied, 'value' is not used.
        value_str - value in string format to be set. supply null if not used and if float value from 'value' should be taken
        unit - unit descriptor for 'value'
        func_id - ID of function to be combined with 'value'. supply 0 if not used
        value_flags - flags describing value attributes simone_write_with_flag()
        src_id - if of local name to be used as source name. supply 0 if not used
        comment - comment to be stored for the entry. supply 'null' if not used.
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicense - no license available
        • simone_status_nofile - no current scenario
        • simone_status_badseq - no current network or scenario not opened in WRITE mode
        • simone_status_invid - invalid object-/extension-ID
        • simone_status_badpar - any other parameter invalid
        • simone_status_noval - ivalid value (out of range)
        • simone_status_locked - scenario is currently modified by another instance
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_include_scenario

        public int simone_include_scenario(java.lang.String src_network,
                                   java.lang.String src_scenario,
                                   int start_time,
                                   int end_time,
                                   int src_id,
                                   int flags)
        includes entries from another scenario into the current scenario.
        Parameters:
        src_network - name of network where 'src_scenario' is located. supply null or empty string for current network
        src_scenario - name of source scenario to be included
        start_time - start time in src_scenario for entries to be included supply 0 for no restriction
        end_time - end time in src_scenario for entries to be include supply 0 for no restriction
        src_id - id of source name to mark all included entries with. supply 0 to mark entries with name of src_scenario
        flags - controls how entries are include
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicense - no license available
        • simone_status_nofile - no current scenario
        • simone_status_badseq - no current network or scenario not opened in WRITE mode
        • simone_status_badpar - any other parameter invalid

      • simone_scenario_save_as

        public int simone_scenario_save_as(java.lang.String new_scenario,
                                   int scenario_type,
                                   java.lang.String inic_file,
                                   java.lang.String comment,
                                   int flags)
        Save actual scenario as new scenario. If the actual source and the new scenario differ in scenario type, the time stamp of the entries in the actual scenario are interpreted in the following way: If the actual scenario is static and the new scenario is dynamic, the time stamp of all entries is set to the start_time of the scenario. If the actual scenario is dynamic and the new scenario is static, all parameter values valid at end_time in the actual scenario are saved in the new scenario.
        Parameters:
        new_scenario - name of new scenario to be created
        scenario_type - type for new scenario to be created or 0: set type from actual scenario
        inic_file - initial state of new scenario to be created empty string or NULL: set comment from actual scenario
        comment - comment of new scenario to be created empty string or NULL: set comment from actual scenario
        flags - controls if the new scenario will be visible (default) or not (SIMONE_FLAG_INVISIBLE), controls if optimization for writing scenario is used (default) or not (SIMONE_FLAG_NO_OPT)
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicense - no license available
        • simone_status_nofile - no current scenario
        • simone_status_badseq - no current network or new scenario already existing
        • simone_status_badpar - any other parameter invalid
        • simone_status_error - internal error
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success
        Since:
        2.66 of the SIMONE API

      • simone_erase_entries

        public int simone_erase_entries(int start_time,
                                int end_time,
                                int filter_id,
                                int filter_flag)
        deletes entries from the current scenario matching supplied properties
        Parameters:
        start_time - start time for entries to be erased. supply 0 for no restriction
        end_time - end time for entries to be erased, supply 0 for new restriction.
        filter_id - ID of profile or source name. only delete matching entries supply 0 for no filter
        filter_flag - if 'filter_id' is supplied controls whether only entries referencing filter_id id are removed (SIMONE_FILTER_ONLY_REFERENCES) or if also the profile identified by filter_id is removed if SIMONE_ERASE_LOAD_PROFILES is set, all load profiles are removed if no filter_id set
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicense - no license available
        • simone_status_nofile - no current scenario
        • simone_status_badseq - no current network or scenario not opened in WRITE mode
        • simone_status_badpar - invalid filter_id
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_erase_entry

        public int simone_erase_entry(int rtime,
                              int obj_id,
                              int ext_id,
                              int cond_id,
                              int flags)
        Delete a specified entry and/or specified conditioned entries from the actual scenario. An entry to be erased must at least be specified with time, object ID and extension ID. Optionally a condition can be specified to restrict erasing to entries which use a specified condition ID. Flags are only necessary, if entries with conditions must be erased: If no condition ID is specified, either all entries specified with time, object and extension are erased if the flag SIMONE_FLAG_ERASE_CONDITIONS is set or only the entry which does not use any condition is erased if the flag SIMONE_FLAG_ERASE_CONDITIONS is not set (default)
        Parameters:
        rtime - time_t value for time of entries to be erased
        obj_id - object ID for entries to be erased
        ext_id - extension ID for entries to be erased special handling for SIMONE_EXT_MODE: erase entries for any mode (ON, OFF, SPO, ...)
        cond_id - condition ID for entries to be erased
        flags - controls how conditioned entries are handled
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicense - no license available
        • simone_status_nofile - no current scenario
        • simone_status_badseq - no current network or scenario not opened in WRITE mode
        • simone_status_badpar - any other parameter invalid
        • simone_status_error - internal error
        • simone_status_not_found - no matching entry found
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success
        Since:
        2.66 of the SIMONE API

      • simone_create_attr_def

        public int simone_create_attr_def(java.lang.String attr_name,
                                  java.lang.String attr_ext_name,
                                  int attr_flags,
                                  int attr_mask,
                                  int attr_type,
                                  java.lang.String default_value,
                                  java.lang.String lower_limit,
                                  java.lang.String upper_limit,
                                  SimInt ext_id,
                                  int flags)
        create a user defined attribute in attribute dictionary.
        Parameters:
        attr_name - description of attribute
        attr_ext_name - extension of attribute
        attr_flags - flag of attribute
        • SIMONE_NO_FLAG - not visible
        • SIMONE_FLAG_VISIBLE - visible in user interface
        attr_mask - object type the attribute can be used with
        • SIMONE_OBJTYPE_CS - compressor station
        • SIMONE_OBJTYPE_CV - control valve
        • SIMONE_OBJTYPE_PIPE - pipe
        • SIMONE_OBJTYPE_RECP - storage
        • SIMONE_OBJTYPE_VA - valve
        • SIMONE_OBJTYPE_SE - shortcut, joint
        • SIMONE_OBJTYPE_RE - resistor
        • SIMONE_OBJTYPE_NS - supply node
        • SIMONE_OBJTYPE_NO - offtake node
        • SIMONE_OBJTYPE_SUB - sub system
        • SIMONE_OBJTYPE_UNIT - unit in compressor station
        attr_type - type of value of attribute
        • SIMONE_DATA_INT
        • SIMONE_DATA_FLOAT
        • SIMONE_DATA_STRING
        • SIMONE_DATA_BOOL
        • SIMONE_DATA_DATETIME
        default_value - default_value of attribute NULL or empty string: do not define a default for values
        lower_limit - lower_limit of attribute NULL or empty string: do not define a lower_limit for values
        upper_limit - upper_limit of attribute NULL or empty string: do not define a upper_limit for values
        ext_id - ID of created attribute extension
        flags - reserved for future use, supply 0
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicense - no license available
        • simone_status_badseq - no current network or an edited version of the network exists
        • simone_status_badpar - invalid parameter(s)
        • simone_status_error - internal error
        • simone_status_locked - attribut database currently modified by another instance
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success
        Since:
        2.65 of the SIMONE API

      • simone_define_function

        public int simone_define_function(int mode,
                                  java.lang.String name,
                                  java.lang.String func_def,
                                  SimInt func_id,
                                  SimInt func_type)
        defines/redefines a SIMONE function.
        Parameters:
        mode - allows to control whether a global (SIMONE_GLOBAL_FUNCTION) or local (SIMONE_LOCAL_FUNCTION) is created
        name - used as function name if new function is to be created (func_id == 0)! supply null or empty string if function is to be modified and function is identified by func_id
        func_def - string containing function definition. Checked for syntactically correctness
        func_id - if == 0 a new function is to be created. if != 0 it should contain a valid function id identifying the function to be modified
        func_type - returns type of function
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicense - no license available
        • simone_status_nofile - no current scenario
        • simone_status_badseq - no current network or scenario opened READONLY
        • simone_status_badpar - invalid function definition / 'name' already in use
        • simone_status_locked - required resources are already in use by another instance
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_define_function_ex

        public int simone_define_function_ex(int mode,
                                     java.lang.String name,
                                     java.lang.String func_def,
                                     int unit,
                                     java.lang.String comment,
                                     java.lang.String category,
                                     SimInt func_id,
                                     SimInt func_type,
                                     int flags)
        defines/redefines a SIMONE function.
        Parameters:
        mode - allows to control whether a global (SIMONE_GLOBAL_FUNCTION) or local (SIMONE_LOCAL_FUNCTION) is created
        name - used as function name if new function is to be created (func_id == 0)! supply null or empty string if function is to be modified and function is identified by func_id
        func_def - string containing function definition. Checked for syntactically correctness
        unit - unit returned by function (if any)
        comment - string containing a comment for a function empty string: do not overwrite existing comment
        category - string containing a category for a function empty string: do not overwrite existing category
        func_id - if == 0 a new function is to be created. if != 0 it should contain a valid function id identifying the function to be modified
        func_type - returns type of function
        flags - reserved for future use, supply 0
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicense - no license available
        • simone_status_nofile - no current scenario
        • simone_status_badseq - no current network or scenario opened READONLY
        • simone_status_badpar - invalid function definition / 'name' already in use
        • simone_status_locked - required resources are already in use by another instance
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_get_function

        public int simone_get_function(SimInt func_id,
                               SimString name,
                               SimString definition,
                               SimInt func_type)
        retrieves information about already defined function.
        Parameters:
        func_id - if == 0 function is identified by 'name'. returns id of function if != 0 should contain valid function ID
        name - used to identify function in case of func_id == 0. otherwise if != null used to return function name
        definition - if != null returns function definition.
        func_type - type of function
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicense - no license available
        • simone_status_badseq - no current network
        • simone_status_badpar - name == null and func_id == 0
        • simone_status_not_found - requested function not found (by func_id/name)
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_execute

        public int simone_execute(SimString status_txt)
        The current scenario is executed and the resulting status text is returned

        Note: This function only works if SIMONE API: Execute Simulation is licensed.

        Parameters:
        status_txt - status of execution. "RUNOK" is returned after a successfull execution. All other texts implies execution with warnings or errors.
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicense - no license available
        • simone_status_badseq - no current network
        • simone_status_nofile - no current scenario
        • simone_status_locked - scenario already locked by another instance
        • simone_status_badpar - wrong or invalid scenario properties
        • simone_status_failed - imcomplete of failed execution
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_execute_ex

        public int simone_execute_ex(SimString status_txt,
                             int flags)
        The current scenario is executed and the resulting status text is returned if SIMONE_FLAG_INTERACTIVE_MSG is set for 'flags', the simone message window is shown during scenario execution.

        Note: This function only works if SIMONE API: Execute Simulation is licensed.

        Parameters:
        status_txt - status of execution. "RUNOK" is returned after a successfull execution. All other texts implies execution with warnings or errors.
        flags - SIMONE_NO_FLAG - run in background, no message window opened SIMONE_FLAG_INTEACRTIVE_MSG - message window is opened and user has to confirm execution. SIMONE_FLAG_EXECUTE_SCENARIO_CHAIN - if the SIMONE_FLAG_EXECUTE_SCENARIO_CHAIN is set and the initial conditions are not existing, calculate all necessary scenarios to create the initial conditions
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicense - no license available
        • simone_status_badseq - no current network
        • simone_status_nofile - no current scenario
        • simone_status_locked - scenario already locked by another instance
        • simone_status_badpar - wrong or invalid scenario properties
        • simone_status_failed - imcomplete of failed execution
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_calculation_status

        public int simone_calculation_status(SimString status_txt)
        returns execution status of current scenario. The scenario must be opened for read.

        status_txt - status of execution. "RUNOK" is returned after successfull execution.
        Returns:

      • simone_set_message_filter

        public int simone_set_message_filter(java.lang.String obj_name,
                                     java.lang.String msg_name)
        sets filter conditions for subsequent call(s) of simone_get_first_message() and simone_get_next_mesage(). Only messages matching the herein defined 'obj_name' and/or 'msg_name' will be returned in above mentioned routines.
        Parameters:
        obj_name - if 'null' the the filter is cleared and message for all objects are returned. otherwise only messages for the supplied obj_name are returned.
        msg_name - if 'null' the filter is cleared and all messages are returned. othewise only messages of the same symbolic name are returned.
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicense - no license available
        • simone_status_badseq - no current network
        • simone_status_nofile - no current scenario
        • simone_status_badpar - supplied message name does not exists
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_get_first_message

        public int simone_get_first_message(SimString msg,
                                    SimTimeT msg_time,
                                    SimInt severity,
                                    SimString obj_name,
                                    SimString msg_name)
        returns the first message from last execution of the current scenario. filter conditions previously set by simone_set_message_filter() are respected.
        Parameters:
        msg - status message to be returned. Supply 'null' if you are not interested in
        msg_time - time (time_t value) of message. -1 if message does not have a time
        severity - reserved for future use.
        obj_name - name of object the message is dedicated to. empty string is message does not apply to a specific object. Supply 'null' if you are not interested in
        msg_name - symbolic message name. supply 'null' if you are not interested in.
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicense - no license available
        • simone_status_badseq - no current network
        • simone_status_nofile - no current scenario or scenario not executed
        • simone_status_not_found - no matching message found
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

        Parameters:
        cscd_import_path - CS configuration file (CSCD), path including name of import file or empty string, if only CS equipment is imported
        csed_import_path - CS equipment file (CSED), path including name of import file or empty string, if only CS configuration is imported
        flags - SIMONE_NO_FLAG import is rejected if an inactive version of file(s) is already existing SIMONE_FLAG_REPLACE_INACTIVE an already existing inactive version of file(s) will be replaced
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicense - no license available
        • simone_status_badseq - API not initialised, no current network selected
        • simone_status_badpar - invalid import path, an inactive version of cscd or csed file is already existing in actual network, import is rejected
        • simone_status_nofile - supplied import file does not exists
        • simone_status_locked - no access to network because it is in use by another instance
        • simone_status_failed - errors from import files
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success
        Since:
        2.67 of the SIMONE API

        public int simone_archive_create(java.lang.String archive_path,
                                 java.lang.String archive_comment,
                                 int flags)
        A new SIMONE network archive is created by this function.

        Parameters:

        archive_comment - comment for new network archive to be created, maybe null.

      • simone_archive_network

        public int simone_archive_network(java.lang.String archive_path,
                                  java.lang.String scenario_list,
                                  java.lang.String comment,
                                  int flags,
                                  java.lang.String password)
        saves the current network in the specified arhive.

        Note: This function only works if SIMONE API: Extensions is licensed.

        Parameters:
        archive_path - complete path of existing SIMONE network archive
        scenario_list - name(s) of scenario(s) or initial state(s) to be archived, separated with ";"
        comment - comment to be stored with the archived network. maybe NULL or empty string.
        flags - SIMONE_NO_FLAG archive type is public archive scenarios filled in scenario_list SIMONE_FLAG_ARCHIVE_SCENARIOS archive all scenarios if set, scenario_list is not interpreted SIMONE_FLAG_ARCHIVE_RESULTS archive calculated results of archived scenarios SIMONE_FLAG_SAVE_PRSIM_RESULTS archive calculated results of PRSIM SIMONE_FLAG_SAVE_LDSIM_RESULTS archive calculated results of leak detection SIMONE_FLAG_DUMP_NETWORK archive also ASCII dump of network SIMONE_FLAG_DUMP_SCENARIOS archive also ASCII dump of scenarios SIMONE_FLAG_ARCHIVE_PROTECTED archive type is protected SIMONE_FLAG_ARCHIVE_PRIVATE archive type is private SIMONE_FLAG_ARCHIVE_MINIMUM_STATES archive initial- and end states of scenarios

        Note:
        Setting of SIMONE_FLAG_ARCHIVE_PROTECTED and SIMONE_FLAG_ARCHIVE_PRIVATE together is not allowed.

        Note:
        If SIMONE_FLAG_ARCHIVE_MINIMUM_STATES is set, SIMONE_FLAG_ARCHIVE_RESULTS is ignored.
        password - password for archive. only used if flags contains SIMONE_FLAG_ARCHIVE_PRIVATE maybe null or empty string for no password
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicense - no license available
        • simone_status_badseq - API not initialised or no current network
        • simone_status_badpar - 'archive_path' is invalid
        • simone_status_nofile - scenarios do not exists
        • simone_status_failed - operation failed. see 'status_msg'
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_extract_network

        public int simone_extract_network(java.lang.String archive_path,
                                  java.lang.String network,
                                  java.lang.String net_time,
                                  java.lang.String dst_network,
                                  int flags,
                                  java.lang.String password)
        extracts an archived network from the archive identified by its name 'network' and, if multiple versions of 'network' exists in the archive, also by the archived date/time supplied with 'net_time'. If the network is password protected the password has to be supplied as well.

        Note: This function only works if SIMONE API: Extensions is licensed.

        Parameters:
        archive_path - complete path of existing SIMONE network archive
        network - name of network to be extracted
        net_time - date and time of archived network. if null or empty string is supplied the NEWEST archived version is extracted.
        dst_network - name of SIMONE network to be extracted to
        flags - reserved for future use.
        password - password for archive. Supply null or empty string for no password.
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicense - no license available
        • simone_status_badseq - API not initialised
        • simone_status_badpar - 'archive_path' is invalid or 'dst_network' already exists
        • simone_status_nofile - specified network (version) does not exist in archive
        • simone_status_failed - operation failed. see 'status_msg'
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_get_license_status

        public int simone_get_license_status(java.lang.String license_server,
                                     SimInt master_slave_mode,
                                     SimFloat life_time)
        This routine provides information about the Master/Slave status of a license server and additionally returns the current lifetime for a SLAVE License Server
        Parameters:
        license_server - hostname or dotted IP-Address of license server to query supply null or empty string to use preconfigured license server from configuration
        master_slave_mode - SIMONE_MASTER if queried license server is a MASTER Server or SIMONE_SLAVE instead
        life_time - remaining lifetime as value between [0.0 .. 1.0] if queried license server is a SLAVE Server. 0.0 means thed SLAVE Server has expired and 1.0 means the SLAVE Server is fully loaded.
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicense - no license available
        • simone_status_badseq - API not initialised, LIVE is not current network
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_start_req_list

        public int simone_start_req_list(int required_type,
                                 SimInt attached_type,
                                 SimInt import_export)
        This routine starts reading data definitions to be used by data preparation programs or data export programs
        Parameters:
        required_type - required type of (cyclic) function as follows 0 use currently configured (cyclic) function SIMONE_REQ_TYPE_RECO reconstruction scenario SIMONE_REQ_TYPE_SIMU look-ahead scenario SIMONE_REQ_TYPE_LEAK input of leak detection SIMONE_REQ_TYPE_USER_1 input of user defined simulation 1 SIMONE_REQ_TYPE_USER_2 input of user defined simulation 2 SIMONE_REQ_TYPE_USER_3 input of user defined simulation 3 SIMONE_REQ_TYPE_EXPORT_PRSIM export of values from last PRSIM SIMONE_REQ_TYPE_EXPORT_ZYSIM export of values from last ZYSIM SIMONE_REQ_TYPE_EXPORT_LEAK export of leak results SIMONE_REQ_TYPE_EXPORT_USER_1 export from a user defined simulation 1 SIMONE_REQ_TYPE_EXPORT_USER_2 export from a user defined simulation 2 SIMONE_REQ_TYPE_EXPORT_USER_3 export from a user defined simulation 3
        attached_type - attached type of (cyclic) function SIMONE_REQ_TYPE_RECO reconstruction scenario SIMONE_REQ_TYPE_SIMU look-ahead scenario SIMONE_REQ_TYPE_LEAK input of leak detection SIMONE_REQ_TYPE_USER_1 input of user defined simulation 1 SIMONE_REQ_TYPE_USER_2 input of user defined simulation 2 SIMONE_REQ_TYPE_USER_3 input of user defined simulation 3 SIMONE_REQ_TYPE_EXPORT_PRSIM export of values from last PRSIM SIMONE_REQ_TYPE_EXPORT_ZYSIM export of values from last ZYSIM SIMONE_REQ_TYPE_EXPORT_LEAK export of leak results SIMONE_REQ_TYPE_EXPORT_USER export from a user defined simulation SIMONE_REQ_TYPE_EXPORT_USER_1 export from a user defined simulation 1 SIMONE_REQ_TYPE_EXPORT_USER_2 export from a user defined simulation 2 SIMONE_REQ_TYPE_EXPORT_USER_3 export from a user defined simulation 3
        import_export - 0: input to SIMONE (datapreparation) 1: output from SIMONE (data export)
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicense - no license available
        • simone_status_badseq - API not initialised, no network selected
        • simone_status_badpar - 'required_type' is invalid
        • simone_status_nofile - no request file found
        • simone_status_error - error reading data definitions
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

        req_type - type of data definition from: SIMONE_REQ_TYPE_RECO SIMONE_REQ_TYPE_SIMU SIMONE_REQ_TYPE_LEAK SIMONE_REQ_TYPE_USER_1 SIMONE_REQ_TYPE_USER_2 SIMONE_REQ_TYPE_USER_3 SIMONE_REQ_TYPE_EXPORT_PRSIM SIMONE_REQ_TYPE_EXPORT_ZYSIM SIMONE_REQ_TYPE_EXPORT_LEAK SIMONE_REQ_TYPE_EXPORT_USER SIMONE_REQ_TYPE_EXPORT_USER_1 SIMONE_REQ_TYPE_EXPORT_USER_2 SIMONE_REQ_TYPE_EXPORT_USER_3
        initime - start time of scenario
        termtime - end time of scenario
        cycle_time - length of cycle in seconds
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicense - no license available

      • simone_position_info

        public int simone_position_info(int object_id,
                                float distance_x,
                                int unit,
                                SimInt obj_id_1,
                                SimInt obj_id_2,
                                SimFloat distance_z,
                                SimFloat distance_1_2,
                                int flags)
        Read distances between a specified node or pipe and terminating elements (not pipes) or terminal nodes
        Parameters:
        object_id - object id of specified node or pipe
        distance_x - distance relative to start of specified pipe, only interpreted if object is a pipe
        unit - unit descriptor for all distance values the distance_x values is to be set with the given unit descriptor, the distance_z value and the distance_1_2 value are to be read with the given unit descriptor which is built from a unit abbreviation (e. g.: "[m]") with the simone_unit2des() function. for SIMONE_UNIT_DEFAULT the distance values are set or delivered with the unit, which is set for length with the simone_set_api_default_unit()
        obj_id_1 - first terminating element in path to object, which is not a pipe if no element (not pipe) existing, a terminal node is returned
        obj_id_2 - second terminating element in path to object, which is not a pipe if no element (not pipe) existing, a terminal node is returned if no element (not pipe) or node existing, obj_id_2 = 0 is returned
        distance_z - distance between object and obj_id_1 including distance_x, if object is a pipe
        distance_1_2 - distance between obj_id_1 and obj_id_2 invalid, if returned obj_id_2 == 0
        flags - reserved for future use
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicense - no license available
        • simone_status_badseq - API not initialised, no network selected
        • simone_status_badpar - wrong object type of object_id
        • simone_status_not_found - no path found including
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_online_init

        public int simone_online_init(java.lang.String task,
                              java.lang.String inic,
                              SimString status_msg,
                              int flags)
        Initialization of a cyclic task The cyclic function must not be active, but the cyclic control must be runnning An initial state may be specified: INIT for a 'cold start', a mapped state, or the terminal state of a scenario indicated by the name of the scenario If none is specified, the last recently calculated state of the respective cyclic simulation is used In case of PRSIM and LEAK, the initialisation by default also initializes the cyclic result storage, the flag 'SIMONE_FLAG_REINIT' may be specified to keep the result history

        Note: This function only works if SIMONE API: Extensions is licensed.

        Parameters:
        task - name of cyclic task "PRSIM" | real-time simulation "ZYSIM" | look-ahead simulation "LEAK" leak
        inic - name of initial state "INIT" or other initial state null or empty string: use "INIT"
        status_msg - string describing status result: msg_sbt_run_ok msg_sbt_error msg_sbt_invalid_apiver msg_sbt_norights msg_sbt_acttopo msg_sbt_no_datadef msg_sbt_wc_ncc_check INIT PRSIM msg_sbt_dataprep_failed msg_sbt_ini_eq_term_try_later msg_sbt_prsim_not_config msg_sbt_restart_fail msg_sbt_runinuse msg_sbt_task_stopped msg_sbt_wc_initzyk INIT ZYSIM msg_sbt_task_stopped msg_sbt_wc_initzyk msg_sbt_wc_task_not_configured INIT LEAK msg_sbt_dataprep_failed msg_sbt_LD_stopped msg_sbt_leak_not_config msg_sbt_restart_fail msg_sbt_runinuse msg_sbt_wc_ld_initzyk
        flags - SIMONE_NO_FLAG - init result history SIMONE_FLAG_REINIT - keep result history
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicense - no license available
        • simone_status_badseq - API not initialised, no network selected, cyclic task(s) still active
        • simone_status_badpar - invalid task
        • simone_status_no_cycle_ctrl - no cyclic task running
        • simone_status_nofile - initial state (inic) does not exist
        • simone_status_locked - task is in use by another process
        • simone_status_failed - errors from executed program use simone_last_error() for detailed information
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_write_message

        public int simone_write_message(int status_code,
                                java.lang.String category,
                                java.lang.String message,
                                int flags)
        Write message into: the SIMONE Cycle Control log window if the API application is running in the context of the SIMONE Cycle Control or into the SIMONE Message Window if running in interactive SIMONE context, for example started from the SIMONE main screen
        Parameters:
        status_code - integer number in range 0 | 1 | [8000..8999] 0 = SIMONE_STATUS_NORMAL: message is shown in black color 1 = SIMONE_STATUS_WARNING: warning or information in ocker color 8000..8999 = SIMONE_STATUS_ERR_BASE + x error message is shown in red color
        category - is a string describing the originator of the message. Generally this can be any string. This string is shown in the column 'Category' of the Cycle Controls log window. if NULL is supplied the name of the programm is used as category string (without path)
        message - message to be shown in the Cycle Controls log window or in the interactive SIMONE Message Window
        flags - reserved for future use
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicense - no license available
        • simone_status_badseq - API not initialised
        • simone_status_badpar - status_code outside range
        • simone_status_error - failed to send message via network
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_cycle_control

        public int simone_cycle_control(java.lang.String task,
                                java.lang.String command,
                                SimString parameter,
                                SimString status_msg,
                                int flags)
        SIMONE Cycle Control functions

        Note: This function only works if SIMONE API: Extensions is licensed.

        Parameters:
        task - - name of cyclic task:
        "PRSIM" | real-time simulation "ZYSIM" | look-ahead simulation "LEAK" | leak "LEAKLOC" | leak localization "*" all cyclic tasks (only allowed for command "DELETE")
        command - - desired function
        "ISACTIVE" | "GETSTATUS" | "DELETE" | "ADD"
        parameter - - command specific parameter(s)
        ISACTIVE supports state: "UNKNOWN" | "INACTIVE" | "ACTIVE" | "DISABLED" | "ENABLED" | "RUNNING" | "DEPWAIT" (default state is ENABLED) if at least the required state is reached, simone_status_ok is returned if not, simone_status_not_found is returned
        GETSTATUS returns state: "UNKNOWN" | "INACTIVE" | "ACTIVE" | "DISABLED" | "ENABLED" | "RUNNING" | "DEPWAIT"
        DELETE supports "DEACTIVATE_ONLY" if not set, controller is deleted
        ADD supports a configuration string, e. g.: "cycle_time=180"
        status_msg - result from executed program msg_sbt_run_ok msg_sbt_norights msg_sbt_invalid_apiver msg_sbt_wc_task_not_configured
        flags - reserved for future use
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicense - no or inappropriate license
        • simone_status_badseq - API not initialised, no network select, open scenario has to be closed before using this function
        • simone_status_badpar - invalid command, 'cyclic task' or parameter
        • simone_status_no_cycle_ctrl - SIMONE Cycle Control not running
        • simone_status_failed - errors from subsequent processes. use simone_last_error() to get details
        • simone_status_not_found - ok, state is not reached in "ISACTIVE" command
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success
        Since:
        2.36 of the SIMONE API

      • simone_net_archive_list_info

        public int simone_net_archive_list_info(java.lang.String archive_path,
                                        java.lang.String archive_network_name,
                                        java.lang.String archive_network_time,
                                        int field,
                                        SimString result,
                                        SimInt flags)
        extracts special information about archived network versions from the network archive

        Note: This function only works if SIMONE API: Extensions is licensed.




        Note:
        The archive_net_time parameter is not interpreted if the field parameter is set to SIMONE_FIELD_NEWEST_TIME.
        Parameters:
        archive_path - archive path of network archive
        archive_network_name - name of next archived network version
        archive_network_time - date and time of next archived network version
        field - select desired information
        result - desired information
        flags - type of next archived network version

        possible values for 'field':
        • SIMONE_FIELD_SIMONE_VERSION return SIMONE version used
        • SIMONE_FIELD_PLATFORM return SIMONE Platform used to build the archieve element
        • SIMONE_FIELD_ARCHIVIST return name of user who archived the archive element
        • IMONE_FIELD_COMMENT return comment for the archive element
        • SIMONE_FIELD_NEWEST_TIME return time for latest archive element with supplied name

        possible flag values returned are:
        • SIMONE_NO_FLAG archive is public
        • SIMONE_FLAG_ARCHIVE_PROTECTED archive is protected
        • SIMONE_FLAG_ARCHIVE_PRIVATE archive is private
        • SIMONE_FLAG_ARCHIVE_PASSWORD archived network version needs password for extraction


        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicence - no license
        • simone_status_badseq - SIMONE API not initialized
        • simone_status_badpar - invalid archive_path,invalid dst_network
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success
        Since:
        2.46 of the SIMONE API

      • simone_nw_handle_release

        public int simone_nw_handle_release(int hnw)
        This routine releases the supplied handle pointing to any SIMONE object like nodes, elements, subsystems, labels, layers, ...
        Parameters:

        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_nw_handle_addref

        public int simone_nw_handle_addref(int hnw)
        This routine increments the reference counter of handle which might be required if the handle was duplicated (by simple assignment). Assigning a handle to another variable without calling simone_nw_handle_addref() would lead to the unpleasant situation that the first call to simone_nw_handle_release() on one(!) of the variables would make the handle invalid and using the handle stored by the second variable would cause an error. If simone_nw_handle_addref() was called after the assignment to another variable, the handle only becomes invalid if simone_handle_nw_release() was called for both variables.
        Parameters:
        hnw - handle to be duplicated
        Returns:
        • simone_status_badpar - the supplied handle is invalid
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_nw_handle_get_type

                                     SimInt handle_type)

      • simone_nw_store

        public int simone_nw_store(int hnw)
        This routine writes the network model data currently in memory to edited network model file on disk. The handle to the network model data is still valid after the store operation and can be used to modify the network further on.

        Note: Any already existing file is overwritten without further notice.
        Parameters:
        hnw - handle to the network model data in memory to be stored
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicence - no license
        • simone_status_badpar - the supplied handle is invalid
        • simone_status_error - internal error
        • simone_status_locked - resource locked. Another process is using the resource exclusively
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_nw_reset

        public int simone_nw_reset(int hnw,
                           int flags)
        This routine clears all data in the network model refered to by the supplied handle. That means all elements/nodes/subsystems/labels/Gas Parameters/ ... are removed and the network model data is set back to the "empty" state. Depending on flags CS and CV description is removed.
        Parameters:
        hnw - handle to the network model data in memory to be reset
        flags - SIMONE_NO_FLAG: keep CS description and CV characteristics SIMONE_FLAG_REMOVE_CS_CV_DESCRIPTION: remove CS description and CV characteristics
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicence - no license
        • simone_status_badpar - the supplied handle is invalid
        • simone_status_error - internal error
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_nw_remove_edited

        public int simone_nw_remove_edited()
        This routine removes any possibly existing edited network topology data file. If the call was successful, a following call of simone_nw_load_edited() would start editing the edited network model data as copy of the active network model data. If there is currently no edited version of the network model data, the routine does nothing but still returns simone_status_ok. no parameters
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicence - no license
        • simone_status_badseq - no network currently selected
        • simone_status_error - internal error
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

        public int simone_nw_node_create(int hnw,
                                 double x,
                                 double y,
                                 java.lang.String name,
                                 SimInt hnode)
        This routine creates a new node at coordinate position (x,y) and returns, if successfull, a handle for the newly created node.

        Note: If no node name is supplied, SIMONE generates a unique name for the node. Additionally the node name is maybe changed again by naming rules for the element using this node in creating the element. See simone_nw_element_create() for further information

        Note: hnode needs to be released using simone_nw_handle_release().
        Parameters:
        hnw - - handle to network model data

        y - - y-coordinate for new node

        hnode - - handle to new node in network model data
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicence - no license
        • simone_status_badpar - invalid handle or hnode is null
        • simone_status_badseq - no network selected
        • simone_status_capacity_exceeded - maximum number of nodes
        • simone_status_error - internal error
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_nw_node_is_knee

        public int simone_nw_node_is_knee(int hnode,
                                  SimInt is_knee)
        This routine returns the information whether a node is knee node. A knee node is a special node inside an element between the start- and end node of the element used only for visualising the elements drawing shape. A knee node neither has a name nor is it visible for the simulation. That means no simulation results are computed during a simulation for a knee node.
        Parameters:
        hnode - - handle to node in network model data
        is_knee - - 0 => node is NOT a knee node, else node IS a knee node
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicence - no license
        • simone_status_badpar - invalid handle or is_knee==null
        • simone_status_error - internal error
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_nw_element_create

        public int simone_nw_element_create(int hnw,
                                    int element_type,
                                    int hstart_node,
                                    int hend_node,
                                    int hsub,
                                    java.lang.String name,
                                    SimInt helem)
        This routine allows to create a new element with type element_type. The new element belongs to the subsystem hsub and has hstart_node as its start node and hend_node as its end node. The new element is created with default values for name and other element variables like diameter etc..

        Note: To create a STORAGE element (SIMONE_OBJTYPE_RECP) which is a single node element, supply a handle for hstart_node and supply 0 for hend_node.

        Note: If you do not supply a name for the element to create SIMONE will assign a default name according to the elements naming rules. start_node and/or end_node which does not have a name set explicitly during node creation (simone_nw_node_create() or assigning a namesimone_nw_node_set_name()) will also renamed according to the name rules for the element

        Note: Creating a pipe (SIMONE_OBJTYPE_PIPE) or joint (SIMONE_OBJTYPE_SE) the element_name parameter is silently ignored.

        Note: helem needs to be released using simone_nw_handle_release().
        Parameters:
        hnw - - handle to network model data
        element_type - - SIMONE_OBJTYPE_PIPE, SIMONE_OBJTYPE_VA, ..
        hstart_node - - handle to start node f new element
        hend_node - - handle to end node of new element
        hsub - - handle to subsystem the new element should belongs to
        name - - name for new element, maybe null or empty. Ignored for pipes/joints
        helem - - handle to created element in network model data
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicence - no license
        • simone_status_badpar - invalid handles or name is invalid
        • simone_status_badseq - no network selected
        • simone_status_capacity_exceeded - maximum number of elements already defined
        • simone_status_error - internal error
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_nw_element_remove

        public int simone_nw_element_remove(int helem)
        This routine removes an exisiting element from the network model data. Nodes connected only to the removed elements are automatically removed. Possibly existing labels refering the element/nodes of the element will not be deleted, but converted into Background labels. After the element was removed successfully, the element handle will become invalid and it is not required to be released explicitely, no simone_nw_handle_release() is needed.
        Parameters:
        helem - - handle to the element to remove
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicence - no license
        • simone_status_badpar - invalid handle
        • simone_status_error - internal error
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_nw_element_set_symbol_position

        public int simone_nw_element_set_symbol_position(int helem,
                                                 int position)
        defines the position of the element symbol within the element This routine allows to define the position of the element symbol within an element. The position is defined as "segment" number starting from 1, where a segment is a leg from one node to the following. An element without any internal knee nodes only has a single segment between the START and END node and the element symbol is drawn on position 1 An elemen with a single knee node is divided into 2 segments (s1=START->KNEE, s2=KNEE->END) and allows to position the element symbol in either position 1 or 2.

        start o---s1---o---s2---O end

        Parameters:
        helem - handle to element
        position - position of the element symbol
        By default the element symbol is on position 1. That means the element symbol is drawn in the first leg behind the start node (in leg s1 in above picture)
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicence - no license
        • simone_status_badpar - helem is invalid position is illegal
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_nw_element_get_symbol_position

        public int simone_nw_element_get_symbol_position(int helem,
                                                 SimInt position)
        queries the position of the element symbol within the element This routine allows to query the position of the element symbol within an element. The position is defined as "segment" number starting from 1, where a segment is a leg from one node to the following. An element without any internal knee nodes only has a single segment between the START and END node and the element symbol is drawn on position 1 An elemen with a single knee node is divided into 2 segments (s1=START->KNEE, s2=KNEE->END) and allows to position the element symbol in either position 1 or 2.

        start o---s1-----o----s2----O end

        Parameters:
        helem - handle to element
        position - position of the element symbol
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicence - no license
        • simone_status_badpar - helem is invalid position is illegal
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_nw_element_get_parameter

        public int simone_nw_element_get_parameter(int helem,
                                           int parameter,
                                           SimFloat value,
                                           SimInt unitdesc,
                                           int flags)
        This routine returns the value of a parameter for an element. The SIMONE User Guide gives an overview of the valid parameters for the different element types. if SIMONE_FLAG_READ_WITH_STORED_UNIT is supplied within 'flags' parameter the value of the requested parameter is returned in the unit set in the network editor and unitdesc returns the unit descriptor. Otherwise the value is returned in the unit described by unitdesc and unitdesc needs to contain a valid uit descriptor for the requested parameter or SIMONE_UNIT_DEFAULT to use the current default unit (set in the environment by configuration file) for the parameter.
        Note: The parameters RIN, ROUT, RESISTANCE do not need a unit, for these parameters supply SIMONE_UNIT_DEFAULT
        Note: The parameter unitdesc may be modified by this function, if the supplied unitdesc is SIMONE_UNIT_DEFAULT or if the supplied flag SIMONE_FLAG_READ_WITH_STORED_UNIT is set.
        Parameters:
        helem - - handle to element
        parameter - - one of SIMONE_API_ELEMENT_PARAMETER_xxx
        value - - value for parameter
        unitdesc - - unit descriptor for value of parameter or SIMONE_UNIT_DEFAULT
        flags - - SIMONE_NO_FLAG | SIMONE_FLAG_READ_WITH_STORED_UNIT
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicence - no license
        • simone_status_badpar - invalid handles or value==null or unitdesc==null
        • simone_status_error - internal error
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

        public int simone_nw_element_get_symbol_size_factor(int helem,
                                                    SimDouble factor)
        This routine returns the size factor used to change the size of the element symbols when drawing. A factor > 1.0 will enlarge the symbol, a factor < 1.0 will shrink it.
        Parameters:
        helem - - handle to element
        factor - - size factor used to change the size of the element symbol when drawing
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicence - no license
        • simone_status_badpar - invalid handle or factor==null
        • simone_status_error - internal error
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success
