      • simone_nw_element_disconnect

        public int simone_nw_element_disconnect(int helem,
                                        int hnode,
                                        float withdraw_ratio)
        This method allows to disconnect an element helem at node hnode. A new node is created connected to helem instead of hnode. The new node is "withdrawn" from the old node using withdraw_ratio related to the length of the element. withdraw_ratio should be in range of ]0.0-1.0[
        Parameters:
        helem - handle to element
        hnode - handle to node
        withdraw_ratio - determines position of newly created node
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicence - no license
        • simone_status_badpar - invalid element/node handle
        • simone_status_error - internal error
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success
        Since:
        2.79 of the SIMONE API

      • simone_nw_element_split

        public int simone_nw_element_split(int helem,
                                   int nsegments,
                                   boolean createKnees)
        This method allows to split an element into several segments. if requested, by supplying TRUE for createKnees, nsegments knees are inserted instead of creating new nodes and element pieces. nsegments has to be in range [2..100] if createKnees is false or [1..100] otherwise.
        Parameters:
        helem - handle to element
        nsegments - number of segments to create
        createKnees - insert knees instead of new nodes and pipe legs
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicence - no license
        • simone_status_badpar - invalid element handle
        • simone_status_error - internal error
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success
        Since:
        2.79 of the SIMONE API

      • simone_nw_label_create

        public int simone_nw_label_create(int hnw,
                                  double x,
                                  double y,
                                  int location,
                                  int href,
                                  SimInt hlabel)
        This routine creates a new label at coordinate position (x,y). A href != 0 should contain a valid handle of the reference network object, either a node or an element. In this case the supplied coordinates are coordinates relative to the reference object. With h_ref = 0 a background label is created which does not have a reference object and the supplied coordinates are absolute coordinates.
        Note: hlabel needs to be released using simone_nw_handle_release().
        Parameters:
        hnw - - handle to network model data
        x - - x-coordinate of label
        y - - y-coordinate of label
        location - - SIMONE_API_LOCATION_TYPE_WORLD | SIMONE_LOCATION_TYPE_SCREEN
        href - - reference object or 0 to create a background label
        hlabel - - handle to label created
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicence - no license
        • simone_status_badpar - invalid handles or hlabel==null
        • simone_status_error - internal error
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_nw_label_remove

      • simone_nw_label_set_scale

        public int simone_nw_label_set_scale(int hlabel,
                                     float scale)
        This routine allows to set a scale factor for labels containing a label image. The default scale factor 1.0 leads to showing the image either in its native pixel size (if set by simone_nw_label_image_set_native_size()) or using the defined dx/dy settings defined by simone_nw_label_image_set_bbox_dx()/simone_nw_label_image_set_bbox_dy().
        A scale factor of 2.0 would enlarge the image by 100% whereas a scale factor of 0.5 would shrink the image accordingly.
        Parameters:
        hlabel - - handle to label
        scale - - scale factor for labels containing a label image
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicence - no license
        • simone_status_badpar - invalid handle or scale <= 0.0
        • simone_status_error - internal error
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_nw_label_get_scale

      • simone_nw_label_set_font_size

        public int simone_nw_label_set_font_size(int hlabel,
                                         float font_size)
        This routine set the font size used to render the text label. The real size of the font used to render the label depends on many circumstances. What can be said is that a font of size 10.0 is only half as big as a font of 20.0 but twice as big as a font of size 5.0.
        Parameters:
        hlabel - - handle to label
        font_size - - font size
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicence - no license
        • simone_status_badpar - invalid handle or fontsize <= 0.0

        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_nw_label_set_zorder

        public int simone_nw_label_set_zorder(int hlabel,
                                      int zorder)
        This routine set the zorder attribute of the label. A label with zorder attriibute SIMONE_API_LABEL_ZORDER_BACKGROUND is drawn in the background, which means it is drawn before the topology and before the FOREGROUND labels. following that topology objects and FOREGROUND labels may overwrite parts of the BACKGROUND label. A FOREGROUND label is drawn last in the sequence hence it will even overwrite network objects like nodes and elements. FOREGROUND is the default for labels without explict zorder settings.
        Parameters:
        hlabel - - handle to label
        zorder - -
        • SIMONE_API_LABEL_ZORDER_FORGROUND
        • SIMONE_API_LABEL_ZORDER_BACKGROUND
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicence - no license
        • simone_status_badpar - invalid handle or zorder is invalid
        • simone_status_error - internal error
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_nw_label_get_zorder

        public int simone_nw_label_get_zorder(int hlabel,
                                      SimInt zorder)
        This routine returns the zorder setting for the label. See simone_nw_label_set_zorder() for a description of the zorder settings
        Parameters:
        hlabel - - handle to label
        zorder - -
        • SIMONE_API_LABEL_ZORDER_FORGROUND
        • SIMONE_API_LABEL_ZORDER_BACKGROUND
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicence - no license
        • simone_status_badpar - invalid handle or zorder==null
        • simone_status_error - internal error
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_nw_label_set_location_type

        public int simone_nw_label_set_location_type(int hlabel,
                                             int location_type)
        This routine sets a location type for the label. A label with SIMONE_LOCATION_TYPE_SCREEN has a fixed position on the screen. That means the label does not move while the topology view is moved. The coordinate system for labels using SIMONE_API_LOCATION_TYPE_WORLD depends on the cordinates for nodes and label defined by the user. The coordinate system for labels using SIMONE_API_LOCATION_TYPE_SCREEN is fixed to a coordinate system with its upper left corner at (0.0, 0.0) and the lower right corner at (1.0, 1.0) The SCREEN coordinate system is related to the window showing the topology.
        Parameters:
        hlabel - - handle to label
        location_type - -
        • SIMONE_API_LOCATION_TYPE_WORLD
        • SIMONE_API_LOCATION_TYPE_SCREEN
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicence - no license
        • simone_status_badpar - invalid handle or location_type is invalid
        • simone_status_error - internal error
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_nw_label_get_location_type

        public int simone_nw_label_get_location_type(int hlabel,
                                             SimInt location_type)
        This routine returns location type of the label. For details see simone_nw_label_set_location_type() for details.
        Parameters:
        hlabel - - handle to label
        location_type - -
        • SIMONE_API_LOCATION_TYPE_WORLD
        • SIMONE_API_LOCATION_TYPE_SCREEN
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicence - no license

        • simone_status_error - internal error
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

                                                int enable)

      • simone_nw_label_set_layer_indicator

        public int simone_nw_label_set_layer_indicator(int hlabel,
                                               long layers)
        This routine allows to set the layer indicator of the label. A label can be assigned to up to 64 layers. The visibility of the label depends on the fact that at least a single layer the label is attached to is visible at the moment the label is drawn. The parameter layers acts as a mask where the i-th bit set means the label is attached to the i-th layer defined in the SIMONE layer dialog.
        Parameters:
        hlabel - - handle to label
        layers - - layer mask. The layer with slot x is included to layers = (1 << (x - 1))
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicence - no license
        • simone_status_badpar - invalid handle
        • simone_status_error - internal error
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_nw_label_get_layer_indicator

        public int simone_nw_label_get_layer_indicator(int hlabel,
                                               SimLong layers)
        This routine returns the layer mask. See simone_nw_label_set_layer_indicator() for details.
        Parameters:
        hlabel - - handle to label
        layers - - layer mask.
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicence - no license
        • simone_status_badpar - invalid handle or layers==null
        • simone_status_error - internal error
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_nw_label_get_visibility_condition

        public int simone_nw_label_get_visibility_condition(int hlabel,
                                                    SimString condition)
        This routine returns the visibility condition of the label if defined. The visibility condition has to be a valid SIMONE expression evaluating to TRUE (!= 0) or FALSE (== 0). Depending on the condition result the labels are displayed (TRUE) or not (FALSE). Without a condition the label is always visible.
        Parameters:
        hlabel - - handle to label
        condition - - visibility condition of a label. A SIMONE expression like "%.P > 50"
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicence - no license
        • simone_status_badpar - invalid handle or condition==null
        • simone_status_error - internal error
        • simone_status_not_found - no condition set for this label
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_nw_label_set_visibility_condition

        public int simone_nw_label_set_visibility_condition(int hlabel,
                                                    java.lang.String condition)
        This routine allows to set the visibility condition of the label. The visibility condition has to be a valid SIMONE expression evaluating to TRUE (!= 0) or FALSE (== 0). Depending on the condition result the labels are displayed (TRUE) or not (FALSE). Without a condition the label is always visible, to remove a condition supply either null or a blank string for condition.
        Parameters:
        hlabel - - handle to label
        condition - - visibility condition of a label
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicence - no license
        • simone_status_badpar - invalid handle
        • simone_status_error - internal error
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_nw_label_get_action

        public int simone_nw_label_get_action(int hlabel,
                                      SimInt action_event,
                                      SimString action)
        This routine returns an action assigned to a label. If action_event is set to SIMONE_API_LABEL_ACTION_NO_CLICK, no action is assigned to the label. action_cmd is a SIMONE command executed if action_event has occured as it would have been entered in the SIMONE command line.
        Parameters:
        hlabel - - handle to label
        action_event - -
        • SIMONE_API_LABEL_ACTION_NO_CLICK
        • SIMONE_API_LABEL_ACTION_LEFT_CLICK
        • SIMONE_API_LABEL_ACTION_LEFT_DOUBLE_CLICK
        action - - SIMONE command to be executed
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicence - no license
        • simone_status_badpar - invalid handle or action_event==null or action==null
        • simone_status_error - internal error
        • simone_status_not_found - no action set for this label
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_nw_label_set_action

        public int simone_nw_label_set_action(int hlabel,
                                      int action_event,
                                      java.lang.String action)
        This routine assigns an action to a label which is executed if the user does a single click (SIMONE_API_LABEL_ACTION_LEFT_CLICK) or a double click (SIMONE_API_LABEL_ACTION_LEFT_DOUBLE_CLICK) onto a label. In these cases the SIMONE command action_cmd will be executed as if the user had entered the command into the SIMONE command line. If action_event=SIMONE_LABEL_ACTION_NO_CLICK is assigned to the label, no action is executed anymore.
        Parameters:
        hlabel - - handle to label
        action_event - -
        • SIMONE_API_LABEL_ACTION_NO_CLICK
        • SIMONE_API_LABEL_ACTION_LEFT_CLICK
        • SIMONE_API_LABEL_ACTION_LEFT_DOUBLE_CLICK
        action - - SIMONE command to be executed
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicence - no license
        • simone_status_badpar - invalid handle or action_event is out of range
        • simone_status_error - internal error
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

The color has to be supplied as an RGB value (red+green+blue) where each color is specified using a number between 0-255. For fully red background the value 16711680=0x00FF0000) id to be set.
        Parameters:
        htext_line - - handle to text label line
        color - - color of text label line if value is above upper limit value
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicence - no license
        • simone_status_badpar - invalid handle
        • simone_status_error - internal error
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_nw_label_image_create

        public int simone_nw_label_image_create(int hnw,
                                        java.lang.String imgpath,
                                        int copy_to_network,
                                        SimInt himage)
        This routine creates a new label image which can later be added to a label. if copy_to_network != 0, the image file is copied from the supplied location into the img subfolder of the currently selected network model and any path information is stripped from image_path. Otherwise the image_path is stored as is and used directly to load the image.
        Note: himage needs to be released using simone_nw_handle_release().
        Parameters:
        hnw - - handle to network model data
        imgpath - - path name pointing to a file containing an image of supported format
        copy_to_network - - 0 => use imgpath as is, else copy image to network model folder
        himage - - handle to create label image
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicence - no license
        • simone_status_badpar - invalid handle or imgpath==null
        • simone_status_error - internal error
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_nw_label_image_set_native_size

        public int simone_nw_label_image_set_native_size(int himage,
                                                 int native_size)
        This routine allows to set the native size attribute of the label image. If set to a value != 0, the image will be drawn in its native pixel size ignoring any other bounding box settings. if set to 0, the image is resized to match the bounding box settings. Without any bounding box settings, the image is shown in its native pixelsize.
        Parameters:
        himage - - handle to label image
        native_size - - 0 => resize image to match bounding box settings, else show image in native size
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicence - no license
        • simone_status_badpar - invalid handle
        • simone_status_error - internal error
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_nw_label_image_get_native_size

        public int simone_nw_label_image_get_native_size(int himage,
                                                 SimInt native_size)
        This routine returns the label image native size attribute. If native_size returns a value != 0, the image is shown in its native pixel size. Otherwise the settings for bounding box applies.

        This routine returns the basic temperature of the networks dead state.

        • SIMONE_NO_FLAG - basic temp. is returned in unit described by unitdesc
        • SIMONE_FLAG_READ_WITH_STORED_UNIT - basic temp. is returned in units set in the network editor and unitdesc is set accordingly
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicence - no license
        • simone_status_badpar - invalid handle or basic_temperature==null or unitdesc==null or invalid
        • simone_status_error - internal error

                                    float default_value,
                                    SimInt hqual)
        This routine allows to create a new gas quality of type SIMONE_API_GAS_QUALITY_TYPE_USER_DEFINED.
        Since SIMONE V6.23 the number of user defined gas qualities was increased from 24 to 48.
        Note: The name of the new gas quality is limited to 4 characters. The maximum number of user defined gas qualities currently is 48. hgasqual needs to be released using simone_nw_handle_release()
        Parameters:
        hnw - - handle to network model data
        name - - name for new gas quality (limited to 4 characters)
        description - - optionally: descriptive text or null or ""
        default_value - - default value for the new gas quality
        hqual - - handle to created gas quality
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicence - no license
        • simone_status_badpar - invalid handle or hqual==null
        • simone_status_error - internal error
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_nw_gasqual_remove

        public int simone_nw_gasqual_remove(int hqual)

        Returns:

        • simone_status_badpar - invalid handle or hqual is not a user defined quality
        • simone_status_error - internal error

      • simone_nw_gasqual_get_type

        public int simone_nw_gasqual_get_type(int hqual,
                                      SimInt quality_type)
        This routine returns the type of the gas quality.
        Note: hqual needs to be released using simone_nw_handle_release().
        Parameters:
        hqual - - handle to gas quality
        quality_type - -
        • SIMONE_API_GAS_QUALITY_TYPE_STANDARD -R,CV,TC,PC
        • SIMONE_API_GAS_QUALITY_TYPE_USER_DEFINED - user defined qualities
        • SIMONE_API_GAS_QUALITY_TYPE_SPECIAL - AFC,CP0A,CP0B,CP0C
        • SIMONE_API_GAS_QUALITY_TYPE_COMPOSITION - XC1,XCN2,..
        • SIMONE_API_GAS_QUALITY_TYPE_TRACE - IC,WC if hfr is enabled
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicence - no license
        • simone_status_badpar - invalid handle or quality_type==null
        • simone_status_error - internal error
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_nw_gasqual_set_default_value

        public int simone_nw_gasqual_set_default_value(int hqual,
                                               float value,
                                               int unitdesc)
        This routine sets the default value of the gas quality (column DEFAULT in network editors gas properties dialog). For gas qualities without unit, supply SIMONE_UNIT_DEFAULT.
        Note: Quality values for all nodes are interpreted with the unit set by the function simone_nw_gasqual_set_default_value().
        Parameters:
        hqual - - handle to gas quality to be removed
        value - - default value of gas quality
        unitdesc - - SIMONE_UNIT_DEFAULT or unit descriptor for R, CV, TC,, PC [IC, WC]
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicence - no license
        • simone_status_badpar - invalid handle or unitdesc is invalid
        • simone_status_error - internal error
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_nw_gasqual_get_default_value

        public int simone_nw_gasqual_get_default_value(int hqual,
                                               SimFloat value,
                                               SimInt unitdesc,
                                               int flags)
        This routine returns the default value of the gas quality (column DEFAULT in network editors gas properties dialog).
        Note: The parameter unitdesc may be modified by this function, if the supplied unitdesc is SIMONE_DEFAULT_UNIT or if the supplied flag SIMONE_FLAG_READ_WITH_STORED_UNIT is set.
        Parameters:
        hqual - - handle to gas quality to be removed
        value - - default value of gas quality
        unitdesc - - valid unit descriptor if flags==SIMONE_NO_FLAG or returns unit descriptor if flag==SIMONE_FLAG_READ_WITH_STORED_UNIT
        flags - -
        • SIMONE_NO_FLAG
        • SIMONE_FLAG_READ_WITH_STORED_UNIT
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicence - no license
        • simone_status_badpar - invalid handle or value==null or unitdesc==0
        • simone_status_error - internal error
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_nw_gasqual_set_computed

        public int simone_nw_gasqual_set_computed(int hqual,
                                          int computed)
        This routine allows to specifiy whether the value of the gas quality should be computed or whether an explicitely set value is used. Only gas qualities of type SIMONE_API_GAS_QUALITY_TYPE_STANDARD or SIMONE_API_GAS_QUALITY_TYPE_SPECIAL can be set to computed.
        Parameters:
        hqual - - handle to gas quality to be removed
        computed - - 0 => quality is NOT computed, else quality is computed
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicence - no license
        • simone_status_badpar - invalid handle
        • simone_status_error - internal error
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_nw_gasqual_is_computed

                                         SimInt computed)

      • simone_nw_node_gas_quality_value_get_float

        public int simone_nw_node_gas_quality_value_get_float(int hgasqual_value,
                                                      SimFloat value,
                                                      SimInt unitdesc,
                                                      int flags)
        This routine returns the float value (including unit if applicable) of the gas quality value. The returned value comes from the table of the network editors gas properties dialog where the line is addressed by the gas quality and the column by the node. Gas quality and node are both encoded in the gas quality value
        Note: The parameter unitdesc may be modified by this function, if the supplied unitdesc is SIMONE_UNIT_DEFAULT or if the supplied flag SIMONE_FLAG_READ_WITH_STORED_UNIT is set.
        Parameters:
        hgasqual_value - - handle to gas quality value
        value - - value of gas quality
        unitdesc - - valid unit descriptor in case of R,CV,TC,PC,IC,WC or SIMONE_UNIT_DEFAULT else.
        flags - -
        • SIMONE_NO_FLAG - value is returned in unitdesc units
        • SIMONE_FLAG_READ_WITH_STORED_UNIT - value is returned in units defined in network editor
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicence - no license
        • simone_status_badpar - invalid handle or unitdescr is invalid or null
        • simone_status_error - internal error
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_nw_node_gas_quality_value_set_computed

        public int simone_nw_node_gas_quality_value_set_computed(int hgasqual_value,
                                                         int computed)
        This routine allows to set whether the gas quality value is set to be computed or not. If set to be computed, SIMONE computes the value from the gas composition. Otherwise SIMONE uses the value which was explicitely set by the user. The value is set to the table of the network editors gas properties dialog where the line is addressed by the gas quality and the column by the node. Gas quality and node are both encoded in the gas quality value.
        Parameters:
        hgasqual_value - - handle to gas quality value
        computed - - 0 => quality is NOT computed, else quality is computed
        Returns:
        • simone_status_nolicence - no license
        • simone_status_badpar - invalid handle
        • simone_status_error - internal error
        • simone_status_ok - in case of success

      • simone_nw_node_gas_quality_value_is_computed

                                                        SimInt computed)
        This routine returns whether the gas quality value is set to be computed or not. If set to be computed, SIMONE computes the value from the gas composition. Otherwise SIMONE uses the value which was explicitely set by the user.
